title: Alfa Romeo - Wikipedia
snippet: Through the 1920s, Alfa Romeo produced several successful road and race cars, and was well represented in prominent European motorsport events, notably winning the inaugural AIACR World Manufacturers' Championship at the 1925 Grand Prix season. Nevertheless, the company soon faced financial troubles, leading to Romeo's contentious departure in 1928 and Italian government ownership in 1933.

title: Is Alfa Romeo Part of Stellantis? | Benson Alfa Romeo
snippet: So who owned Alfa Romeo during this time? Between 1932 and 1986, an Italian state-holding company owned Alfa, and Alfa Romeo joined the Fiat Chrysler Group. The company then became Alfa Romeo Automobiles S.p.A as a subsidiary of Fiat, also known as FCA or Fiat Chrysler Automobiles.

title: Who owns Alfa Romeo? | Alfa Romeo History | Genesis Alfa Romeo
snippet: The name Alfa is actually an acronym for, “Anonima Lombarda Fabbrica Automobili” – A.L.F.A. In the formative years between 1932 and 1986, the Alfa was owned by an Italian state holding company, which then led to Alfa being under the Fiat ...

title: History of Alfa Romeo - Wikipedia
snippet: The history of Alfa Romeo, an Italian car manufacturer known for producing sports cars, began on June 24, 1910, with the founding of ALFA (an acronym for "Anonima Lombarda Fabbrica Automobili") in Milan. In 1918 the company changed its name to "Alfa Romeo" following the acquisition of control ...

title: Who Owns Alfa Romeo? | Where is Alfa Romeo Made?
snippet: In 1932, the Italian state holding company owned Alfa, which lasted until 1986. During these years, Alfa joined the Fiat group. Then in February 2007, it became Alfa Romeo Automobiles S.p.A.
